A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
While this is not a perfect movie by any stretch of the imagination\, the audience score I feel is very unfair. The main criticism of TFA was that it was too cookie-cutter and didn't take any risks. I feel that TLJ is the response to that criticism. You can't have it both ways people! This film took risks. I respect that. 

Luke Skywalker\, for me\, growing up was one of my biggest heroes in film. I was very anxious to see him portrayed in this movie. I maintain that while I didn't agree with some of the character choices made and feel disappointment in his arc in some ways\, Luke was still fantastically portrayed by Mark Hamill. I still love and always will love Luke Skywalker and find him bittersweet in this movie. Which I think...is kind of the point here guys. 

I'm rating the movie higher than I would otherwise\, just seeing the ridiculously low score. I feel it needs to be made up for to some degree. I would rate this movie 8/10.
